metadata.title: The Ethical Dilemma
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: You notice something questionable inside the company — mismatched numbers, hushed voices, and signals that something is wrong. You must choose whether to protect truth, harmony, the company, or yourself. Your values, courage, and judgment will be tested.
metadata.hint: Tests Integrity mindset, Courage in judgment, Harmony preference, and Risk sensitivity

dimensions.label: Integrity
dimensions.description: How strongly you protect truth, fairness, and ethical standards

dimensions.label: Courage in judgment
dimensions.description: How willing you are to speak up and act despite consequences

dimensions.label: Harmony preference
dimensions.description: How much you prioritise peace, relationships, and group stability

dimensions.label: Risk sensitivity
dimensions.description: How you weigh personal, professional, and organizational risk

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: You Notice Fraud Indicators
scenes.body:
The numbers don’t match.
Rumors circulate quietly.
People avoid eye contact when you walk past.

You sense something unethical unfolding — and you are now part of the awareness.
scenes.tip: Your first instinct signals your ethical foundation.

options.label: C
options.desc: You protect yourself and company image.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: Your Findings Deepen
scenes.body: You dig deeper. More inconsistencies. More whispers. Something serious may be happening — and the responsibility now feels heavier.
scenes.tip: This choice reveals your investigative ethics.

options.label: B
options.desc: You test truth through direct dialogue.

options.label: D
options.desc: You step away to protect yourself.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: Management Asks Indirectly
scenes.body:
A manager approaches casually: “Have you heard anything unusual lately?”

The tone is soft — but the intent feels sharp.
scenes.tip: Your answer tests courage under subtle pressure.

options.label: B
options.desc: You preserve harmony while signalling caution.

options.label: C
options.desc: You gather intent before revealing truth.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: Retaliation Risk
scenes.body: You learn that others who reported similar issues faced retaliation. Fear enters the equation. What now?
scenes.tip: This choice reveals your risk–courage balance.

options.label: C
options.desc: You gain time for safer action.

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: HR Says: “Stay Quiet”
scenes.body:
HR pulls you aside: “Stay quiet for now. We’ll handle it internally.”

You hear the request — but also the request *between the lines.*
scenes.tip: This choice shows your ethical non-negotiables.

options.label: B
options.desc: You buy time and avoid conflict.

options.label: C
options.main: Ask for a formal legal process.

scenes.label: scene6
scenes.title: Shadow You Appears
scenes.body:
A darker version of yourself appears: “Do you fear the truth… or fear its cost?”

The question sinks deep.
scenes.tip: Your philosophical choice reveals core values.

options.label: A
options.desc: You anchor identity in moral clarity.

options.label: B
options.desc: You aim for fairness with diplomacy.

scenes.label: scene7
scenes.title: Final Ethical Door
scenes.body:
Three doors form before you:

COURAGE — Speak truth regardless of cost
BALANCE — Navigate integrity with diplomacy
SAFETY — Protect stability above conflict
scenes.tip: This final door represents your ethical identity in crises.

growthSuggestions.text: Your values are strong, but you hesitate in conflict. Strengthen courageous communication.
Your desire for peace may dilute ethical clarity. Build comfort with difficult truths.
Your sensitivity to danger may limit action. Create safety nets to enable principled decisions.
Your honesty is powerful — but may feel harsh. Blend truth with empathy for better influence.
Your ethical instincts show developing balance. Continue refining how you protect truth while navigating complex environments.
